author: Somanath Tripathy
text: 'This would be easily 4 stars because the food ordered (Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Kali Mirch
column5: and Chicken Biryani) and the time of delivery were great. What sucked is the free dal they give along with the food and rice. The dal smelled pungent and my friends and I failed to understand how a dal can be so bad. Either it was very poor quality lentils or some weird spice
column6: and tasted way different from any other Indian dal. The restaurant will be better off removing the free dal and reducing the price of the entrees slightly instead.'

text: 'I really like the food but the staff were very rude specially the person who stands in the front of the counter he don‚Äôt know how to talk to customers.'

text: 'so slow'

author: Adrienne Choma

author: Srinivas Naik

author: Aakash Sareen
text: 'Some staff members are exceptionally rude with no care for customer service making it an overall quite bad experience. I will not recommend this restaurant and will rather recommend other Indian restaurants in the area.'

author: saroj lenka
text: 'Starts with one line "it\'s a spoiler"\n\nNot sure how folks reviewed and flgiven it 5 stars even. Tried with paneer tikka
column5: veg biryani and chicken biryani. First of all surprised to see wierd and unusual starters menu for vegetarian like pakoras
column6: chats although non-vegetarian was ok. When asked they were okntpbgive paneer tikka
column7: so I had the worst tikka for first time in Karma cafe. It wasn\'t tandoor cooked but flamed. Only paneer covering was charcoaled and flavored while inside its raw paneer taste. Then coming to biryani
column8: it smells good but they were like pulao
column9: not biryani styled procedure. Also a bad smell was coming off the rice or something which is more of a old stock of rice or oil smells like rancid.. Absolutely shocked to feel amazed after tasting these nonsense. May be other things are good
column10: but not for me at least.'

author: Jesabel Cruz
text: "Oh my heavens! The food is so deliciously authentic that I felt I was at my friends' home! The use of spices is pure perfection
column5: the portions are generous
column6: the staff is welcoming and all at reasonable prices. They've created excellent Karma and I will definitely return."

author: Utkarsh Yadav
text: 'I‚Äôve been ordering from this place for a while now
column5: but I visited them this weekend to be disappointed with their unauthentic Chai and unexpected cheap Spring Mix in every dish.'

author: William Hayes
text: "Karma kafe is a intimate dining spot specializing in Northern Indian cuisine.\nLocated on Washington Street in Hoboken
column5: it offers a varied selection of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian entrees.  The restaurant offers both indoor and outdoor dining. There's a full bar available with a complete lineup of all types and levels of spirits.\n\nMy dining experience began with an excellent assortment of appetizers to choose from. I've recently ordered the Kabob sampler..an assortment of chicken and lamb kabobs.  There's the baked wings which were delicious and juicy. These are prepared in a delectable sauce. The Karma Aloo is a vegetarian dish made with potatoes that was excellent.  Also on the menu are the Vegetarian or Chicken Pakoras
column6:
very tasty and well prepared.

The Ginger Conconut Chicken is a must order.  This soup will be one of the best tasting soups you will ever have...ever!

I recently ordered the Tandoori Chicken.
This is a full half chicken baked in the tandoor.  An absolutely superb meal...
tender and juicy... prepared with just enough spices... and cooked to perfection.

Also
column7:
the Chicken Makhani or Butter Chicken is simply the most delicious dish one could order. Dark chicken pieces cooked in a butter tomato sauce..absolutely to die for.

Not to be missed is the Shrimp Malabar.
Jumbo shrimp cooked in a Conconut sauce served with rice.  It doesn't get any better.

If hot and spicy is what excites your palette its the Chicken Vindaloo to order.
Chicken and potatoes in a very fiery sauce. A Goan specialty.

I always order Naan bread.
This delicious bread complements any of the choices and comes in a variety of selections: plain
column10:
onion or cheese.

A great beverage choice is a mango Lassi. Its sort of a smoothie which can be ordered with or without alcohol.

Kheer or traditional rice pudding is a great end of dinner dessert.

The staff is well versed in the menu and the preparation of all offerings.  They are friendly and professional.  A number of the staff have been with KK for over 10 years.

If you crave really delicious and well prepared and presented Indian food this is the place to get yourself over to.

I will say that ..due to each dish being made-to-order....be prepared to enjoy the evening leisurely..nothing is rushed!"

author: Ranvir Singh
text: 'Service could be nicer. Waiter was not the nicest.'

author: Mary McDevitt
text: 'While I have never been to the actual restaurant
column5: my husband and I order take out all the time and I can say confidently that the food here is amazing. The portion size is  hardy and the food always shows up fast. This place is affordable and has turned out to be one of our regular spot. If you are sick of cooking at home this is a great option.'

author: Rakin Muhtadi
text: 'Nice little restaurant. I had their samosa Chaat and it was delicious. Their biriyani was great too. Small but Loved the decor'

author: Muktanidhi Dhotrad
text: "Overall it was good. The food was tasty and they did make the food spicy as requested. The portions are huge
column5: especially chicken biryani. One of the laccha paratha wasn't cooked properly. The ambience is nice and the service is quick."

author: Amey Phatak
text: 'Reunion went well with good food! It was a fine Sunday afternoon meeting with a couple of friends from school after a long time and food was important to keep the reunion alive and happening. So we chose this place
column5: Karma cafe to meet. Starting with appetizers we ordered vegetable kebab and karma aloo. Both were delicious
column6: specially loved the karma aloo. With the drinks we ordered sparkling wine
column7: both white and red. It was perfect. In the main course we ordered malai kofta and bread platters. It was good but hoping for a better taste. Overall
column8: the presentation and service was nice. Looking forward to try again other appetizers. Thank you for the good food.'

author: Jake Diaz
text: 'Waited over 30 min for our waiter. Waiter didn‚Äôt even give us straws for our water.'

author: Amit Dutta
text: "2 stars for the service and location but the food was bad. Perhaps it was a one off experience but I won't recommend their Chicken Adraki. It was like sweet tomato chutney that came along with chicken."

author: Shelley Hamilton
text: 'Recommended by friends and did not disappoint. Delicious Indian food with lots of choices on the menu. Indoor and outdoor seating was available with minimal wait time. Staff was efficient and courteous.'

text: 'Brilliant food. Highly recommended.'

author: Linda Lou Kettleman
text: 'We had the chicken Tikka marsala . It was great.'

author: Sir Haris
text: 'Their food is one of the top Indian food joints I know of. The flavor is always consistent and flavorful. The tandoori shrimp and the veggie pakora are amazing! These people don‚Äôt play around with the spice levels so be careful when you order the vindaloo. I die every time.'

author: Mike
text: "Generous portions
column5: the food was very tasty and lots of vegan options. Some of the best Indian food I've ever had in my life. Worth the trip."

text: 'The food is really good but it is a tad bit on the expensive side. However it is totally worth it! I recommend the Chicken Makhani and Naan.'

column5: is

author: Shareen Fatima
text: 'It‚Äôs a nice little joint in the heart of Washington st
column5: hoboken. The interiors and colors take you back to India. Our server was friendly.\nFood was flavorful. The mango mock tail was too sweet for my taste. The portion size for their dinner platters is great for one person. They have a good selection of vegetarian options.'

author: Kecia Cotton (Kay)
text: "One of my staff members ordered her lunch from there on Saturday. She had the Lamb. I don't eat lamb
column5: pork
column6: or beef. I asked her just too purchase me some Naan. Which she did. It was delicious! Before I left. I ordered Chicken Marsala. I went to Karma Kafe and picked it up. I didn't eat
column7: until I got back to Brooklyn. When I got home. I sat down comfortable and ate my dinner. At let me tell you. It was worth the wait. Such a fresh delicious dish it was. Between the Basmati rice
column9: it took a day and a half too finish the dish. Excellent meal Karma Kafe. Thank you!"

text: "Had ordered mutton biryani and chicken hariyali wings. Mutton was not cooked

column5: maybe they changed the old chef. But biriyani is extremely oily and naan was extremely hard. It‚Äôs honestly not worth the money.'

text: "Great place
column5: a little expensive though. They used to have afternoon buffet for 10 dollars on weekdays and 15 on weekends. It was a total value for money deal. Talking about the food in general

author: Seth Victor
text: "The best curry in Hoboken
column5: hands down. The korma is amazing
column6: the bindi masala makes my heart sing

column11: and every time it's been a nice experience. Oh
column12: and the naan is always fluffy and buttery. I can't add too much to what has already been said in the other reviews

author: Kordian Witek
text: 'Best long time Indian restaurant in Hoboken and downtown Jersey City area'

author: Bhumi Patel
text: 'Horrible service. Probably the worst service I have ever had at any restaurant. I called ahead of time and was told that ‚Äúwhile we can‚Äôt guarantee a table because we don‚Äôt take reservations
column5: if you come in the next 30 mins we‚Äôll try our best to hold a table for you.‚Äù Show up in the heat and sun and are immediately told you‚Äôre going to have to wait ANOTHER 30 mins instead of offering an 85 yr old man and 80 yr old woman the option to at least sit inside at an empty table while they wait. I go inside to ask what happened and the waiter gave me so much attitude telling me that it‚Äôs my fault I showed up expecting a table and that I should have some respect and not cause a scene. After 20 minutes we were finally seated and then the waiter came outside to tell me that being angry didn‚Äôt do anything and that they would‚Äôve seated them inside anyways. Really? That was not at all offered when we showed up. We were simply turned away and told to wait. When we finally sat down
column6: considering the sun and the fact that other tables were now open we asked if we could move into the shade and the same waiter scoffed and made a face at the request. The owner is no better and is definitely behind the power trip that rude waiter is on because of lack of accountability and a culture that does not care about service
column7: only making a profit. I‚Äôve read the other reviews and they mention a staff member who had an attitude
column8: and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm speaking about the same person in this review.'

author: Yuvraj Patel
text: 'Good food and good quantity! Nice place for breakfast
column5: lunch and dinner in Hoboken! Not hard to find street parking on a bust day. Good options for non-veg
column6: lesser options for veggies. Tried Kashmir panner(‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê)( PTM not available) and kofta kaju(‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê) for entrees and tandoori panner(‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê) for starter
column7: panner was fresh and soft. Karma bread basket had veg and non veg options for naan and had a plenty amount of naam for party of 4. Unlimited papad and chutney
column8: sabzi comes with rice and dal. Would definitely suggest this place in Hoboken for Indian food. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê for service.'

Friends do yourself a favour and don't order from them. I m sure anyone can cook better Indian food then them at home."

Wish I had taken some pictures to post with my review...But will be back soon...Next time will make sure to take pictures of my entr√©es...Kudos to the staff...Perfect service!!! Last bit not least...Alchohol selection was also extensive..."

author: Ami Patel
text: 'Over hyped. I was really looking forward to this place since months
column5: but food was just average.\n\nFood: Flavors are average. Papri Chat was really good. Paneer Makhani - asked the waiter to make it spicy
column6: it was extremely mild. We were running out of time
column7: so
column8: didn‚Äôt bothered to get it changed. Dal was meh. Garlic Naan was average. Lachha paratha was really chewy and not fresh. The plain rice served with the curry was AMAZING. You can really taste good quality grains. Unfortunately rice was the only food I would like to come back for.\n\nService: It was good. Waiter offered to get the curry changed
column10: we didn‚Äôt have time to wait for that.\n\nAmbience: Really good. Love the artisanal tables and the vibe overall.'

author: sayan dhara
text: "Last night I ordered(uber eats) for Chicken Biriyani and it was full of sugar
column5: raisin and red cherries!!\nLiterally I was confused
column6:
whether I am eating a dessert or biriyani.
Thanks God it was written on the pack!
When I called restaurant to report the same and they are simply denying it. Even I asked to take the food back for testing they don't want to do it either.

Earlier it was good but may be due to Covid they are not good anymore."

text: "Good food. Cheaper than I was expecting. Quick and attentive staff. There were raisins in almost every dish.... not sure if this is normal

author: Sarah Kozinski
text: 'I ordered takeout from Karma Kafe. My order was ready on time. In terms of set up
column5: they only allow 3 people inside and have booths set up (takeout
column6: order
column7: etc). Each entree comes with rice and dal. I got the kashmiri paneer
column10: as well as 2 pieces of garlic naan. The naan was big
column12: and deliciously garlicky. The kashmiri paneer is my favorite from there. It was a good spice and has a delectable saffron flavor. Their paneer is one of the softest I have ever had. It almost just melts in your mouth as you eat it. I definitely enjoy the food from here'

author: Luke Vanderberg
text: "My favorite Indian place in Hoboken

column6: but we usually go back to the Kashmiri Chicken
column7: Lamb Korma
column8: and Veggie Biryani.  Worth a visit."

author: Joseph Jacob
text: 'Most disappointing experience
column5: mediocre food and awful service. The food we got was bland and tasteless
column6: which would have still made for an OK night if the service at karma kafe was at least half decent. Dismissive body language and absolutely no warmth from any of the servers throughout the night. They were clearly very focused on their take out orders and payed no care in the world for the people dining in. We also witnessed this complacent behaviour with other guests
column7: shocking to say the least. Never going back there !'

author: Jheisson Perozo
text: 'Amazing service'

author: Dhatrish Rajdev
text: "This review is based on their Chicken biryani; haven't tried their other dishes.\n\nTheir biryani is everything that a well prepared biryani should be - flavorful
column5: aromatic
column6: plentiful
column7: less oily (yes it matters)
column8:
perfectly marinated & cooked chicken (this one had boneless non-breaded chicken - just the way I love it and you will too). All the complex layers of flavors available in one bowl where each one can be picked up unmistakably by the palate.

The only two cons I found were 1) Tamarind still had the seeds in it 2) Quantity of Raita was too little to go with the biryani.

I could eat this every week w/o a second thought. Finest biryani place in JC/Hoboken. Suitable for delivery also."

author: sue sue
text: 'Alot of flavorful food‚ù£‚ù£‚ù£‚ù£'

text: 'Good food and have been ordering quite regularly over the years. Recently an incorrect item was delivered. The staff at the phone offered no apology or regret or made attempt to look into it. All Resturant‚Äôs bungle up but courteous staff can make it all feel good. Karma cafe can benefit from better staff'

text: "Place is very clean
column5: staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Food is fresh and authentic to the best of my knowledge
column6: far superior quality and taste to other Indian restaurants that we've been to. Portions are large
column7: we shared  The kebabs
column8: tikka masala chicken and lamb briani and had leftovers to take. Will definitely be returning many more times."

author: Jolie Rose
text: "If you're thinking about ordering from here: DO IT! This is amazing quality & quantity Indian food at fair prices. Perfect amount of spices and all dishes that we've tried over the past few months have been outstanding. Customers for life!"

author: Cameron Wells
text: 'I ordered the Crab Cake Makhani. This dish is a complete rip off. For $21.00 I expected to be eating crab CAKES (as it says on their menu)
column5: not simply a slop of garlic tomato sauce with minuscule pieces of crab meat. On the tip of my fork in the picture you can see one of the tiny pieces of crab meat they sprinkled in the sauce.'

author: imran kherani
text:
'This review is specifically for the quality and business practice at Karma Kafe.
Food is good but make sure you check your order before you start munching on it. Recently I ordered paneer kashmir and I was served with chicken kashmir so I called them asking if chicken is halal which was not. I can understand you guys are busy but seriously you played with my religious practice for which I will take necessary steps.
Also there is one of the staff member who talks rudely and is arrogant ( trust me one can spot him easily) dude if you are frustrated with your job then please map the exit door.
About owner thanks for offering me juice or the pudding as a bribe not to write any reviews or take any further action. You are elder figure to me but your Kafe‚Äôs Karma is not looking good. Good luck with your frustrated staff.'

author: sanchay mahuwale
text: 'Though the food is fine but the behavior of the staff is rude.'

author: Abdullah Turkistani
text: 'So good and clean'

author: Amish Bhavsar
text: "They served Vegetable Medley with the sticker on the Bell Pepper. That means they cooked the bell pepper with the sticker on it. That means they don't even wash the vegetables before they cook the food.\nThis is not only unhygienic but unsafe and unhealthy for those who consume this food."

author: sahil popli
text: 'Very poor quality Indian food
column5: took one bite and had to trash the food.  I ordered vegetarian starter items and onion kulcha. The samosa
column6: aloo tikki and pakoda looked burnt from outside and tasted as if they were cooked several days back. The kulcha was about 3/4 of an inch thick
column7: partially uncooked and no onion.'

author: Gideon Katz
text: 'Delicious. Big portions. Nice outdoor seating.'

author: Akhil
text: 'Stunning food
column5: excellent service
column6: consistency for last several years.  Brilliant establishment.'

author: Nishant Kumar
text:
"Amazing food and ambience.  Here's our rating of individual dishes we ate:
Tandoori Shrimp - 10/10
Chicken Samosa - 7/10
Chicken Malabar - 9/10
Papri Chat - 10/10
Karma Cafe Naan - 7/10
Hariyali Chicken Wings - 9/10

All in all
column5: we can't complain about anything. The service was prompt and servers were friendly. Highly recommend."

author: saurabh kesari
text: 'I love this restaurant
column5: they are the most economical restaurant in Jersey city and very well cooked.'

author: Ash M
text: 'Having been to this place pre-COVID19 and liking what I had ordered with them at the time
column5: I ordered delivery and the food either lacked flavor or was horrible this time round. The kheema paratha contained thin slices of meat instead of ground meat and was tasteless. We also got the lamb boti kabab
column6: lamb seekh kabab
column7: and palak paneer and everything was flavorless. Never ordering from them again!'

author: Alan Hom
text: 'The food is always excellent and the staff is friendly..'

author: Mark Pasculli
text: 'One of the best places for Indian food. Amazing food and generous portions.'

author: Kayleigh Harrington
text: 'Amazing food and great service. You can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on the menu. Paneer makhani
column5: chicken tikka
column6: garlic naan are all favorites.'

author: Luminita F
text: 'Stop making such good food
column5: i‚Äôm gonna get so fat o_O'

author: Alexander Schulmeister
text: 'Excellent modern Indian in the heart of Hoboken. The spices are subtle enough for my Eastern European palate.'

author: Raj Shah
text: 'Best authentic indian food I have had in NJ'

author: Khevna Bhavsar
text: "Love it!!! If you eat spicy food
column5: they have vegetarian vindaloo Sabzi. It's mind blowing"

author: Prathamesh Bandekar

author: Esteban Alfaro
text: 'Since the moment the you enter in the place to the moment the you leave the experience is beyond amazing

author: Emmanuel Alfaro
text: 'Very good food and service. Highly recomended.'

author: Vit√≥ria Silva
text: 'My favorite Indian restaurant. I love how they create off menu creations when I ask for it. Their lamb biryani is the best.'

author: Nishikesh LNU
text: "Are you looking for great Indian food and some spicy taste. This is the right place for you. Great people best service and the price is very affordable too. Due to pandemic they have special arrangement so you won't be disappointed do go there."

author: Leigh Hester
text: "Absolutely delicious
column5: authentic food with very courteous staff. Can't wait to visit again!"

author: Deepak Bhat
text:
'Order through Uber Eats. Appetizer and the entree were good.

But the only reason why I‚Äôm going with 1 star overall is the dessert I ordered (Gajar Halwa - pic posted) had MOLD on it! ü§¢

I usually don‚Äôt post reviews but when a customer pays for the food and it turns out to pose a significant health risk (especially during this time) is a strict no no. I reached out to the restaurant promptly to report this and they just asked me to contact Uber Eats customer service which I later did.

Don‚Äôt ever serve food that doesn‚Äôt meet minimum safety / hygiene standards! Also
column5: stop treating Indian desserts as second class (serving food with fungus just to empty out the stock is disgusting). Hope you fix such blunder going onwards.'

author: suah yekeh
text: 'Good Food
column5: I dont remember seeing alcohol  drinks. Good for a family night out'

author: Sophia T
text:
'(Translated by Google) Amazing naan!

(Original)
Amazing naan!'

author: Aditya Jain
text: 'It use to be one of the go place sometime back for me but for a while seems the staff is flying high with attitude & behavior issues ... for sure no longer will be'

author: walter dirkin
text: "This place is great! Good food
column5: great people. I've never left disappointed."

author: Hardik Dattani
text:
'Good food
Polite staff
Great taste
Good quantity

COVID related precautions could be better.'

author: Juan Medina
text: 'Terrific food. Quick service
column5: excellent customer service.'

author: Kim MacDonald
text: 'The food and atmosphere are great! The people who work there are wonderfully nice!'

author: Maddy R
text: 'Amazing food
column5: excellent service
column6: clean and friendly place! The chicken vindaloo was to die for'

author: Hanna Chumakova
text: 'We love coming to this place every week or so to share one Chicken Tikka Masala for two for just $16. They always offer a free starter which is very rare of places like that. Absolutely delicious Indian cuisine with reasonable prices
column5: quick service
column6: exceptional staff members and a cozy interior.'

author: Aliaksei Alioshka
text: 'One of our family favorite place in Hoboken.\nAlway fresh
column5: tasty and delicious food.\nThe staff here is very friendly and professional.'

author: mostaan Saremi
text: 'Food is great. I love mango shake they have.'

author: Lauren Sternberg
text: 'First time. Best indian food I have ever had. Kabul was attentive and made great recommendations.\nWill be back over and over.'

author: Bethany Longer
text: 'Food was flavorful and a good value for how much you get. Outdoor seating was nice and the staff was extremely kind and attentive. Made for a lovely lunch break :)'

author: Raj Seth
text: 'Cute place for a small family of four birthday dinner. Close to the waterfront so you are able to go for a walk after dining outside. The outdoor seating could be a little bit nicer if the put up lights and candles. Paneer Tika masala was epic!'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'I‚Äôve come here for the lunch buffet before Covid and it was good. I just ordered pick up today and the naan was terrible and stale
column5: couldn‚Äôt eat it. The chicken biryani was amazing though but I can‚Äôt get over how stale and thick the naan was :/'

author: Jiaren Li
text: "Buffet or delivery from this place is amazing
column5: with a variety of options.\nUpdate: Well the buffet part of review didn't age well
column6: but with the reopen
column7: definitely an amazing place to get some superb quality Indian food at amazing value! Naan has been amazing and memorable as always. I would recommend order for pickup for anyone to at least try it (don't forget mango lassi)"

author: Jayant Mehta
text: 'Tasty Indian food. Loved it. Service is little bit slow. Rest Everything is good. Friendly staff and pocket friendly.'

author: Skandhan Nethi
text: 'Great food and amazing service üëç'

author: Joseph Amorosa
text: 'The most accommodating and friendly customer service I have had in a long time. They really understand that taking care of a customers satisfaction speak volumes about your business and your commitment to your community. Exquisite food!!! I wish I could find a better word to articulate. Tasty
column5: savory
column6: and just the right amount of spice. I would highly recommend the vegetable jalfrezi. Thank you once again to the manager and kitchen staff. Namaste üôèüèº'

author: Neil Shah
text: 'Great place
column5: they have outdoor seating so great during these covid -19 times. The appetizers here are really good! Sunny has great service.'

author: Dev Sam
text: 'Never gonna order naan and curry from here. .! Very bad .!'

author: Rada Prince
text: 'I will never go there again when you order for pick up you will wait more then 30 min ridiculous customer service'

author: Benjamin Atwater
text: 'This place has good food and has been reliable and consistent the last several times
column5: but my experience tonight as not what I expect of karma kafe. I placed an order online at 7:40 for what was supposed to be a 15 minute ready time - and here I am waiting outside 42 minutes after I placed it. I am very upset that my experience tonight was not up to the standard of karma kafe. Had I not paid for my order I would have left as I have other calls throughout the night. Please ensure this doesn‚Äôt happen again as it will cause you to loose business from people like me who have otherwise been loyal and supportive of your establishment'

author: sandy996
text: 'Love the food and taste is really good'

text: 'Probably one of the top Indian restaurants I‚Äôve eaten at! Wonderful food
column5: super flavorful and tasty! Good prices and kind staff. Thank you Karma Kafe!'

text: 'Delicious!!'

text: 'A very underrated restaurant. This is definitely my favorite Indian spot.. The food is amazing. The garlic Naan and mango mojito are my favorite things on the menu.'

text: 'Authentic tasty Indian food with a smile!'

author: Rita Yousef
text: 'Great place! The dine  in was great. Food was very nice and a beautiful sitting area. The staff were very helpful. Had a great time. Definitely recommend!'

column6: and the naan.... omg'

text: 'Small place with ok food.'

text: 'Went here for the $10 lunch buffet
column5: and it is truly worth your money. Be sure to be early or come a little bit before opening time. The place is fairly small and fills quickly. Very soft naan and bread. Overall a good choice for your lunch break!'

text: 'Staff cares for customers very less.... They have their own world and they barely pay attention to customers...place is very badly organized. Food is more than good but service is poor.... But if you cant provide a good service...good food wont make big difference...'

text: 'A great spot with amazing Indian food! But not always lucky to find a place to seat as whenever I come the place is always full of people.'

text: 'Stale Chicken in Chicken Biryani. Food was not properly processed.'

text: 'Great for a $9.95 lunch buffet.  The food is fresh
column5: hot
column6: and tasty.  I wish they had chicken tikka masala when i went
column7: but i liked almost everything else just fine.  It gets pretty packed but seats open up quickly. And i noticed a bar in the back and this sign on my table so im pretty sure you can get your drink on here.'

text: 'Excellent food I had vegetarian'

author: Harry Singh
text: 'Haryali Wings - One of the best Chicken wings I have ever eaten with Indian flavor. It took some time to arrive but that implied the dish being made fresh. Was worth the wait. Reminded me of afghani chicken from streets of Delhi . Absolutely must try for everyone.'

text: 'Best Indian food buffet restaurant üëåüòã'

text: 'The Lamb vindaloo is amazing
column5: all their food is amazing. I‚Äôd suggest trying their Pakore Aswell. Been going here for years and the taste and quality consistency is on point. When you ask to making something ‚Äúspicy‚Äù they really do make it spicy SPiCY üëåüèº'

column5: great taste. Place is easily visible in normal traffic. The only challenge is to find a seat during busy hours.'

text: 'Incredible food

column7: fresh

author: F Branch
text: 'I admire this place a lot. there is a nice ambiance. The kitcen is superb. the service is dynamic and the stuff is polite. The price is decent. profoundly recommend.'

author: Bharat Bhavsar (Rohan)
text: 'One of the best Indian food I have tested here in USA. We ordered the veg platter
column5: paneer tikka and veg biryani and some cocktails. All items were perfect. Just wow. I would recommend this place to every Indian who do wants to have authentic Indian taste. I am going to visit this place often for sure.'

author: Anuj Mittal
text: 'Neighbourhood Indian place where we go out very frequently for comfort food. It has decent vegetarian options both in main course and starters but we end up ordering kofta makhani everytime we go and have not gotten bored of it at all. It is the only place where Malai kofta is better than any Indian place in India as well. They definitely put something in it to make it so amazing and addictive :)'

author: Mohit Mirani
text: 'One of the best Indian restaurants to go to in Hoboken. Quantity of the delicacies is really good and tasty as well.'

author: vishwan aranha
text: "Food was partly decent but some items were stale for the lunch buffet.The staff was very indifferent and could care less.The place was poorly organized where there was barely any space to walk around. If they do provide fresh and hot food with better variety it will be worth visiting else it's worse than other Indian food place I have been to.There was just one dessert dish unlike other places which have some varieties to choose from.Overall I would give it 2 stars as the food was not fresh and didn't really stand out.If they organize the seating better and improve the quality and variety of dishes they offer I would reconsider visiting again or updating my review."

author: Kajol Jain
text: 'The food was amazing for great price. Everything we ordered was tasty.'

author: Zygfryd Dabrowski
text: 'My favorite restaurant!'

author: Joelle Stasak
text: 'Great staff
column5: average food. Reasonable prices.'

author: Harsweet
text:
"Nice restaurant and food. Situated in Hoboken.
Street parking available.
Prices are not bad and food quantity is moderate.

Staff is nice
column5: however place is cramped
column6: but they joined tables for us (party of 2) since it wasn't that crowded. That was nice gesture."

author: Donwan Harrell
text: 'Amazing freshly baked Nan bread and Indian food. My only comment is that the sauce of the butter chicken dish should be a little thicker. I felt is was a little watery compared to most other Indian restaurants..other then this the food
column5: decor
column6: and service was great.'

author: Sandy Pepin
text: 'Buffet style food.....yummy.'

author: Dan Szyc
text: 'The food is tangy and perfect. I enjoyed the fresh naan
column5: it was warm and buttery. It was tough to get to the basmati rice because it was in the corner. Otherwise
column6: the experience was excellent and the food was perfect.'

author: April Palozie
text: 'I never leave reviews. This food was...disgusting? My fiance said its "doodie meat."  It tastes like extremely spicy
column5: bland pasta sauce. I\'ve had better seasoned Prego. And- its really expensive for what it is. SKIP THIS JOINT.'

author: Akshay More
text: 'Good place. Specially good for lunch as it has buffet for a cost effective price. Nice service.'

author: Amol Kothari
text: 'Great food and quantity'

author: Raxit Majithiya (Rax)
text: 'Great for dinner. Skip the buffet.'

author: Tiago Mokwa
text: "OMG the best chicken Tikka masala ever!!! Nothing else to say. Don't go
column5: so I don't have to wait for table."

author: Nikhil Kekan
text: 'Ordered paneer Kashmiri on grub hub. worst food
column5: totally bland with no taste at all. anyone
column6: literally anyone can cook a better food than this restaurant. shameful priced.i regret spending as much as 20$ on it.'

author: Urmi Ahir
text: 'Food was good'

author: Shima
text: 'Delicious'

author: Amna Rauhullah
text: 'if you order online
column5: be prepared to wait a long time. I called after placing an order an hour ago only to be told there will be additional 10-15 mins. It seems like the order was not even seen at their end. Their food is good but their online service leaves a lot to be desired.'

author: Janki Patel
text: "This is one of the best Indian restaurants! Amazing vegetarian options
column5: and the  presentation skills are 10/10. When it comes to the taste- it's very authentic
column6: and original. Unlike other places
column7: their naans are very fresh/soft!  Absolutely love this place and it's customer service."

author: Hyunjae Lee
text: 'Very westernized Indian food but nonetheless
column5: its tasty and lunch buffet offers a variety of options and reasonably priced especially for lunch buffet'

author: Priya Gautam
text: 'Good Indian food. Their lunch buffets are worth trying'

author: Ke Sa
text: "Found chewing gum in food (in salsa) The piece we found was clearly stretching. Complained about it and Waiter went defensive and claimed it was mozzerela cheese. I told him mozzerela does not stretch specially when cold. He was not ready to accept it's a honest mistake and started arguing about it. So asked him to get a cold mozzerela piece and showed him that cold mozzerela does not stretch
column5:
it clearly did not (it fell apart in pieces and crumbs). He then came up with a new theory that it was a hot piece of mozzerela in that salsa. So asked him to heat it up and add it to salsa and bring it. Once again it did not stretch once the cheese was in cold salsa and cooled to below room temperature in cold salsa. Another waiter came and said they are sorry about it and offered free food. However we walked out without eating due to all the drama we had to put up to prove it was not mozzarella and was really a piece of gum. All they needed to do was accept their mistake in first place and move on.

We were a frequent customer but now completely lost trust in this place after finding gum in the food.

Never going to go there again!"

author: Scott Wolfenden
text: 'Located on Washington St. in the heart of Hoboken
column5: Karma Kafe offers great North Indian food with excellent service
column6: good ambiance
column7: with menu items and a lunch buffet with a generous selection of succulent Indian dishes and deserts.  The masala tea is authentic and tasty
column9: unlike some restaurants where the authenticity is hit and miss (freeze dried India tea with a pod of cardamom hardly qualifies as masala tea
column10: which is what you get in some places). Weekday and weekend lunch usually draws something of a crowd
column11: but  though the restaurant is usually close to full
column12: there is rarely a wait for a table. Waiters are professionals who have been with the restaurant for years
column14: friendly and helpful. The restaurant also features alcoholic beverages and a small bar. Dress is come as you are
column15: whether casual or dressed for the office. It is not a place you will hang out all night
column16: but where you are more likely to eat and leave when you are finished.'

author: Lasantha Samarasekara
text: 'Good Indian cuisine.'

author: Urvashi Gupta
text: 'A very special restaurant with amazing food.'

author: Raymond Smith
text: 'Best spot for Indian in Hoboken'

author: Gagan Bhardwaj
text: 'Food is good
column5: but they mainly offer fast service to the online delivery. For dining
column6: people have to wait ages to get food. Service is also not good specially when there is little crowd in the cafe.'

author: Julie Iacovides
text: 'Really enjoyed their food and the service was great. We had our toddler with us and they were extremely accommodating in making some non-spicy curry for him. He loved it as well!'

author: Veronica Lewis
text: 'Never capitalize on the pain of others. Karma will get you.'

author: John Rod
text: 'You are a disgrace to America'

author: Sagar Sapre
text: 'Best mutton biryani ever in United States.'

author: Jessie Mckay
text: 'Always quality food'

author: Steven Hoffenson
text: 'Watch out - they will overcharge your credit card!\nThe food is good for the lunch buffet
column5: but they are dishonest if you pay by credit card. On at least 3 occasions
column6: they have overcharged my credit card by adding more to the tip (once they added 50%
column7: for a self-serve buffet...). Fortunately
column8: my credit card company makes it easy to dispute the charge
column9: but I imagine they are ripping off countless others in this way...'

author: Christopher Hatton
text: 'Fantastic time. Wonderful food
column5: helpful staff. We had a big party
column6: and they handled us seamlessly.'

author: Mayur
text: 'Food was good. They just need to better their services.'

author: Kurt Alfred Kluever
text: 'The best Indian food in Hoboken no questions asked. The staff is insanely nice and accommodating. The lunch buffet is one of the best deals in town. Highly recommended!!!'

author: arisai hernandez
text: 'Absolutely love this place. Food is yummy especially the buffet! Yes!'
